item.title: Photo highlights of the day: Milan Expo and a Cornish seahorse
item.trailText: Syrian refugees at the Turkish border, the Indian heatwave, Milan Expo, and a giant horse on a Cornish beach
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world, including Syrian refugees at the Turkish border, the Indian heatwave, Milan Expo, and a giant horse on a Cornish beach

displayImages.caption: Calcutta, India Locals cool off under street taps as temperatures reached 39C. The heatwave has been blamed for almost 1,700 deaths in India Photograph: Piyal Adhikary/EPA
displayImages.altText: Calcutta, India Locals cool off under street traps as the temperatures reached 39 degree Celsiu. According to reports the death toll from temperatures which have hit a 20 year high have claimed almost 1700 lives as Indians, especially in the south continue to suffer
displayImages.cleanCaption: Calcutta, India Locals cool off under street taps as temperatures reached 39C. The heatwave has been blamed for almost 1,700 deaths in India

displayImages.caption: Sanliurfa, Turkey Turkish military use water cannon to stop Syrian refugees trying to cross border fences near Akcakale Photograph: Osman Orsal/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Sanliurfa, Turkey Turkish military use water cannon to stop Syrian refugees as they wait behind the border fences to cross into Turkey, near Akcakale
displayImages.cleanCaption: Sanliurfa, Turkey Turkish military use water cannon to stop Syrian refugees trying to cross border fences near Akcakale

displayImages.caption: Seoul, South Korea A medical worker in a negative-pressure isolation room at a hospital where a patient with MERS was admitted. South Korea confirmed two more deaths from MERS and reported 13 new cases, bringing the number of infections to 108, with 3,439 people in isolation for possible infection Photograph: EPA
displayImages.altText: A medical staffer works at a negative pressure isolation sickroom at a Seoul hospital where a patient of the Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) was admitted
displayImages.cleanCaption: Seoul, South Korea A medical worker in a negative-pressure isolation room at a hospital where a patient with MERS was admitted. South Korea confirmed two more deaths from MERS and reported 13 new cases, bringing the number of infections to 108, with 3,439 people in isolation for possible infection

displayImages.cleanCaption: Athens, Greece Ronnie Renner of the US jumps in front of the Academia to promote the Red Bull X-Fighters World Tour at the Dionyssos Marble Quarry

displayImages.caption: Milan, Italy Visitors are eflected on a ceiling of the Russian pavilion at the Expo 2015 before the arrival of Vladimir Putin at the exhibition Photograph: Olivier Morin/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: People are reflected on a ceiling of the Russian pavilion at the Milan Expo
displayImages.cleanCaption: Milan, Italy Visitors are eflected on a ceiling of the Russian pavilion at the Expo 2015 before the arrival of Vladimir Putin at the exhibition

displayImages.caption: Cornwall, UK A horse attempts to escape the tide in a piece of sand art created to promote the return of GWR Polo On The Beach at Watergate Bay. The work measured 54 metres by 64 metres Photograph: Mikael Buck / GWR

displayImages.caption: Utah, US Electric blue pools of potash stand out next to miles of red canyons and mountains. But the pools are not for swimming but are the tip of an elaborate and intricate mining operation in the middle of the desert near Moab Photograph: Jassen Todorov/Solent News
displayImages.altText: Utah, US The electric blue pools of potash stands out next to the glorious landscape made up from miles of red canyons and mountains. But the electric blue pools are not for swimming but are the tip of an elaborate and intricate mining operation - the potash evaporation ponds lay in the middle of the desert near Moab

displayImages.caption: Baku, Azerbaijan A general view of the Heydar Aliyev Cultural Center ahead of the first European Games Photograph: Michael Steele/Getty Images

displayImages.caption: Veles, Macedonia Migrants walk through a tunnel on their way to Macedonia’s border with Serbia. Migrants from impoverished and war-torn countries in Africa, the Middle East and central and south Asia walk through Macedonia to reach Serbia in the hope of crossing the European Union border into Romania, Hungary and Croatia Photograph: Robert Atanasovski/AFP/Getty Images
displayImages.altText: Veles, Macedonia Migrants walk through a tunnel on their way to Macedonia’s border with Serbia. displayImages.caption: Los Angeles, California, US A woman protests the death of Ezell Ford during a meeting of the Los Angeles Police Commission. The Los Angeles police commission will review the findings of the city’s police chief and an inspector general that two officers were justified in opening fire on an unarmed black man who investigators say tried to grab one officer’s gun Photograph: Patrick T. Fallon/Reuters

displayImages.caption: Buenos Aires, Argentina Argentine policemen stand guard at the Pueyrredon bridge blocked by demonstrators of leftist parties (unseen), during a strike. Transport unions in Argentina launched a 24-hour strike at midnight Monday over a tax regime they say hurts the lowest earners Photograph: Eitan Abramovich/AFP/Getty Images

displayImages.caption: West Sumatra, Indonesia A different kind of high wire: students crossing the river on a 50-metre-long rope at Langgai village. Every day dozens of primary and secondary pupils travel through terraced rice fields and cross rivers on ropes to reach school Photograph: Sijori/Barcroft India
displayImages.altText: West Sumatra, Indonesia School run: Students crossing the river on a 50 meter long rope at Langgai village. Every day dozens of elementary and junior high school students travel through terraced rice fields and cross rivers on ropes to reach their school

displayImages.caption: Amritsar, India A worker with the Red Cross Society picks up an abandoned baby boy found at a pangpura (cradle) drop-off location for unwanted babies, built in 2008, in an attempt to curb female infanticide Photograph: Narinder Nanu/AFP/Getty
displayImages.altText: Amritsar, India A worker with the Indian Red Cross Society picks up an abandoned baby boy found at a pangpura (cradle) drop-off box. The premises contains a drop off location for unwanted babies, built in 2008, in an attempt to curb female infanticide
displayImages.cleanCaption: Amritsar, India A worker with the Red Cross Society picks up an abandoned baby boy found at a pangpura (cradle) drop-off location for unwanted babies, built in 2008, in an attempt to curb female infanticide

displayImages.caption: Aleppo, Syrian Rescuers and civilians help to bring people out of a building after a reported barrel bomb attack by government forces on the central al-Fardous rebel-held neighbourhood Photograph: Karam Al-Masri/AFP/Getty
displayImages.altText: Aleppo, Syrian Rescue workers and citizens evacuate people from a building following a reported barrel bomb attack by Syrian government forces on the central al-Fardous rebel held neighbourhood
displayImages.cleanCaption: Aleppo, Syrian Rescuers and civilians help to bring people out of a building after a reported barrel bomb attack by government forces on the central al-Fardous rebel-held neighbourhood

displayImages.caption: Vasylkiv, Ukraine Smoke from a fuel depot fire outside Kiev. Emergency services are trying to prevent the spread of the fire, and three firefighters are reported missing after the blaze triggered a powerful explosion. The fire burned overnight and by morning had spread to at least 16 tanks, most of them storing petrol, sending a huge pall of smoke over the area Photograph: Valentyn Ogirenko/Reuters
displayImages.altText: A man rides a horse cart, as smoke from a fuel depot fire billows in the background. Emergency services are battling to prevent the spread of a deadly fuel depot fire outside Kiev, and three firemen were reported missing after the blaze triggered a powerful explosion. The fire burned overnight and by morning had spread to at least 16 tanks, most of them storing petrol, sending a huge pall of smoke over the area
displayImages.cleanCaption: Vasylkiv, Ukraine Smoke from a fuel depot fire outside Kiev. Emergency services are trying to prevent the spread of the fire, and three firefighters are reported missing after the blaze triggered a powerful explosion. The fire burned overnight and by morning had spread to at least 16 tanks, most of them storing petrol, sending a huge pall of smoke over the area

displayImages.caption: London, UK Swimmers at the Hampstead Heath ponds are treated to a little culture with their morning dip in the form of a floating art gallery. The gallery was created by the Affordable Art Fair to celebrate the opening of the Hampstead fair, which runs from 11 to 14 June Photograph: Rex
displayImages.altText: Swimmers at the Hampstead Heath ponds were treated to a little culture with their morning swim - in the form of a floating art gallery. The gallery was created by the Affordable Art Fair to celebrate the opening of the Hampstead fair which runs from 11-14 June
displayImages.cleanCaption: London, UK Swimmers at the Hampstead Heath ponds are treated to a little culture with their morning dip in the form of a floating art gallery. displayImages.altText: Indian policemen detain a Kashmiri government employee, seen from inside a vehicle, during a protest

displayImages.caption: Paris, France Migrants, mostly from Sudan, prepare to sleep on Place de la Chapelle last night. They were living in makeshift camps nearby, which were evacuated on 2 and 8 June. The EC is ready to discuss new ways to admit and distribute asylum seekers in the EU. See Christian Sinibaldi’s Calais reportage here Photograph: Joel Saget/AFP/Getty
displayImages.altText: Paris, France Migrants prepare to sleep on Place de la Chapelle. Most of the migrants are from Sudan, who were living in makeshift camps near this area, which were evacuated on June 2 and June 8. The European Commission is ready to discuss new ways to admit and distribute asylum seekers in the EU

item.title: Photo highlights of the day: ladies day at Epsom
item.trailText: New graffiti at Le Pont des Arts, vigil for the victims of capsized Yangtze cruise ship and the ladies day at Epsom racecourse
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world, including new graffiti at Le Pont des Arts, vigil for the victims of capsized Yangtze cruise ship and the ladies day at Epsom racecourse

displayImages.altText: Phnom Penh, Cambodia Horses race during a ceremony at Pring Ka-Ek village, where oxcart and horse racing is organised to continue local traditions of paying respect to the Neakta Pring Ka-Ek (spirit house) to help people overcome diseases and for abundant rice harvests and other agricultural yields
displayImages.cleanCaption: Phnom Penh, Cambodia Participants take part in a horse race during a ceremony at Pring Ka-Ek village. item.title: Photo highlights of the day
item.trailText: Anti-government protests in Bujumbura, a mock funeral in Baghdad, and a pop-up kitten cafe in Sydney
item.standFirst: The Guardian’s picture editors bring you a selection of the best photographs from around the world including anti-government protests in Bujumbura, a mock funeral in Baghdad, and a pop-up kitten cafe in Sydney

displayImages.caption: Bujumbura, Burundi Anti-government protesters demonstrate near a burning barricade. Burundi’s army chief says an attempted coup has failed and forces loyal to Pierre Nkurunziza are in control, a day after another general announced that he had sacked the president for seeking an unconstitutional third term in office Photograph: Goran Tomasevic/Reuters
displayImages.altText: Protesters, who are against President Pierre Nkurunziza’s decision to run for a third term, gesture in front of a burning barricade. The head of Burundi’s army said on Thursday that an attempted coup had failed and forces loyal to Nkurunziza were in control, a day after another general said he had sacked Nkurunziza for seeking an unconstitutional third term in office
displayImages.cleanCaption: Bujumbura, Burundi Anti-government protesters demonstrate near a burning barricade.
